attributes.action: Start screening all newly diagnosed diabetes patients for pancreatic cancer.
attributes.additional_details: Mortality figures for pancreatic cancer haven’t improved in 50 years. 75% diagnosed with the disease die inside a year and just 6% make it to 5 years. It is the deadliest of the 21 most common cancers. Early detection of Pancreatic Cancer means life-waving surgery is possible. But there are no bio-markers or tests for GPs. Scientists know that 1% of people newly-diagnosed with diabetes has pancreatic cancer. That’s about 4,000 UK people each year whose lives could be saved. We need a Taskforce.
attributes.background: Many campaigners want the government to fast-track the screening of newly diagnosed diabetes patients for pancreatic cancer. There are two stand-out tests available, one in trial phase in the UK, and one licensed this year in the USA. We want the government to make these available to GPs.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about screening for patients are a matter for the NHS and individual clinicians, not the Government or Parliament. As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to provide additional funding for pancreatic cancer screening, but new screening procedures would still need to go through the usual processes before being deployed.
